Description: Tondo and foot sherd of Attic black-figured pottery type C stemless cup; in tondo, black-figure decoration consisting of gorgoneion (lower edge of left eye, part of left ear, nose, mouth with tongue with added red, teeth and fangs in added white, and beard remaining); exterior black with red band on ridge at foot join; glazed black on underside with reserved band at junction of base and foot.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For parallels, see Cambridge Museum of Classical Archaeology NA224, NA225, Oxford G1079 and Bristol H2015.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 436-7, no. B704)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0672) (Phase 1)
